en.label: Golarion Calendar (Pathfinder 2e)
en.description: The Absalom Reckoning calendar system used throughout Golarion, the campaign setting for Pathfinder Second Edition. Features twelve months with leap years following Gregorian rules.

pf2e.description: PF2e weekday calculation already matches expectations - no offset needed.

months.name: Abadius
months.description: The first month of winter, named after Abadar. A time of commerce, trade negotiations, and planning for the coming year.

months.name: Calistril
months.description: The shortest month, named after Calistria. A time of passion, revenge, and dramatic winter storms. Gains an extra day in leap years.

months.name: Pharast
months.description: The last month of winter, named after Pharasma. A time when the boundary between life and death grows thin.

months.name: Gozran
months.description: The first month of spring, named after Gozreh. Nature awakens and new growth begins throughout the land.

months.name: Desnus
months.description: The second month of spring, named after Desna. A time of travel, dreams, and the pursuit of freedom and luck.

months.name: Sarenith
months.description: The third month of spring, named after Sarenrae. The sun's warmth grows stronger as summer approaches.

months.name: Erastus
months.description: The first month of summer, named after Erastil. A time of hunting, farming, and community gathering.

months.name: Arodus
months.description: The second month of summer, named after Aroden. The peak of summer's heat and the height of human achievement.

months.name: Rova
months.description: The third month of summer, named after Rovagug. A time when the Rough Beast's influence is said to be strongest.

months.name: Lamashan
months.description: The first month of autumn, named after Lamashtu. Harvest time begins, but dark creatures stir in the growing shadows.

months.name: Neth
months.description: The second month of autumn, named after Nethys. A time of magic and mystery as the veil between worlds thins.

months.name: Kuthona
months.description: The third month of autumn and start of winter, named after Zon-Kuthon. The year's darkest month begins.

weekdays.name: Moonday
weekdays.description: Named after the moon, a day for reflection, planning, and quiet contemplation

weekdays.name: Toilday
weekdays.description: A day for hard work, labor, and productive endeavors

weekdays.name: Wealday
weekdays.description: A day for prosperity, trade, and community prosperity

weekdays.name: Oathday
weekdays.description: A day for keeping promises, honoring commitments, and sacred vows

weekdays.name: Fireday
weekdays.description: A day of passion, energy, and vigorous activity

weekdays.name: Starday
weekdays.description: A day for learning, magic, and studying the celestial patterns

weekdays.name: Sunday
weekdays.description: A day of rest, worship, and renewal under the sun's blessing

seasons.name: Winter
seasons.description: The cold season when snow blankets much of Golarion's northern regions.

seasons.name: Spring
seasons.description: The season of renewal when Golarion awakens from winter's grip.

seasons.name: Summer
seasons.description: The warm season of growth and adventure across the Inner Sea region.

seasons.name: Autumn
seasons.description: The harvest season as communities prepare for the coming winter.

absalom-reckoning.name: Absalom Reckoning
absalom-reckoning.description: Standard Pathfinder Society calendar used throughout the Inner Sea region

imperial-calendar.name: Imperial Calendar
imperial-calendar.description: Chelish Imperial dating system used in Cheliax and its territories

Abadius.name: First Imperial
Abadius.description: The first month of the Imperial calendar, marking the beginning of the fiscal year in Cheliax.

Calistril.name: Second Imperial
Calistril.description: The second month of the Imperial calendar, often marked by increased devil worship ceremonies.

Pharast.name: Third Imperial
Pharast.description: The third month of the Imperial calendar, when the Imperial bureaucracy reaches peak activity.

varisian-traditional.name: Varisian Traditional
varisian-traditional.description: Traditional Varisian calendar with local cultural names and seasonal focus

Calistril.name: Winter's Heart
Calistril.description: The coldest month when Varisian caravans seek shelter and tell stories by the fire.

Pharast.name: Death's Door
Pharast.description: The final month of winter when the veil between life and death grows thin.

Gozran.name: Spring's Awakening
Gozran.description: The first month of spring when Varisian caravans begin their travels anew.

Sarenith.name: Sun's Blessing
Sarenith.description: The warm month when Varisian festivals celebrate Desna and the open road.

earth-historical.name: Earth Historical (AD)
earth-historical.description: Earth Anno Domini calendar for modern campaigns and real-world synchronization

Abadius.name: January
Abadius.description: The first month of the Gregorian calendar.

Calistril.name: February
Calistril.description: The second month of the Gregorian calendar, shortest of the year.

Pharast.name: March
Pharast.description: The third month of the Gregorian calendar, marking the arrival of spring.

Gozran.name: April
Gozran.description: The fourth month of the Gregorian calendar, known for spring growth.

Desnus.name: May
Desnus.description: The fifth month of the Gregorian calendar, peak of spring.

Sarenith.name: June
Sarenith.description: The sixth month of the Gregorian calendar, beginning of summer.

Erastus.name: July
Erastus.description: The seventh month of the Gregorian calendar, peak of summer.

Arodus.name: August
Arodus.description: The eighth month of the Gregorian calendar, late summer.

Rova.name: September
Rova.description: The ninth month of the Gregorian calendar, beginning of autumn.

Lamashan.name: October
Lamashan.description: The tenth month of the Gregorian calendar, mid-autumn.

Neth.name: November
Neth.description: The eleventh month of the Gregorian calendar, late autumn.

Kuthona.name: December
Kuthona.description: The twelfth month of the Gregorian calendar, beginning of winter.
